alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 8:49AM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .Freezing rain has spread northeastward through the region this morning. Slick road conditions have been observed for portions of southeast Minnesota thought western/north central Wisconsin. Several slide offs have been reported. Even with air temperatures slowly climbing above freezing throughout this morning, ground temperatures holding near freezing would lead to icy conditions to linger into the late morning. North of I-94, freezing conditions will persist into the afternoon, but an eventual change over to snow for areas north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin. Accumulations of 1 to 2 inches is anticipated by this evening. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. Roads that appear wet may actually be icy. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain with icing up to 1/4 inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Jackson County. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions. Power outages and tree damage possible.The morning commute will be impacted.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
